column4: nutrinomass thank you but that fix is only for a toshiba satellite laptop an isnt a genral fix for screen resolution options
i need more options than just 640 400

It's a general guide form what I see ... https://help.ubuntu.com/community/FixVideoResolutionHowto . Again, in short all you need is 'sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg' . Before that, make sure you backup your /etc/X11/xorg.conf file somewhere (if you mess up the configuration you might end up with a graphical display )
